title: Rodeo Labs Flaanimal 6 Titanium
content:
The Flaanimal is Rodeo Labs‘ multi-category cycling platform and the titanium version just got its sixth notable upgrade. Let’s check it out…

First introduced in 2021, the Flaanimal Titanium is built on the extremely successful and versatile Flaanimal Steel series of bikes, first released in 2017. The bike’s design has been proven across its entire use spectrum, from road to gravel, to rugged and ultra-endurance bikepacking, with a notable win at Tour Divide in 2021. Its sixth version was just announced and with it, some notable upgrades…

EC44 Hourglass Head Tube

The Flaanimal Ti 6 has a new hourglass-shaped EC44 head tube.

    • 44mm press-in headset cups
    • CNC machined Titanium
    • Integrated routing Support

Sculpted Tubesets and 3D Printing

6 Ti features a distinctive silhouette with a custom profiled top tube that tapers elegantly as it approaches the seat tube, then wraps around the seat tube and blends effortlessly into the seat stays. This is achieved through a combination of 3d printing, expert welding, and hand finishing.

  • Full-Length Tapered top tube
  • blended seat tube cluster
  • shaped seat stays

Lock Jaw 2 Dropouts

The Flaanimal 5 slider design has served Rodeo Labs well for years, but with the advent of UDH derailleurs, it was time for the brand to create an improved sliding dropout system that solved for new derailleur engineering while shedding mass and complexity. Lock Jaw 2 builds on slider concepts first pioneered in TD4, and refines them for the current drivetrain era.

  • Native UDH Compatibility
  • Standard hanger Compatibility
  • Singlespeed Compatibility
  • 30mm of slider range
  • Future Proof

Configurable

Flaanimal 6 Ti has endless options for build kits. Find out more about this unique offering at Rodeo Labs.

The post Rodeo Labs Flaanimal 6 Titanium appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
